Reviews.Title: “AHH PARIS”
Reviews.Author: Lunicoonie
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is within walking distance of Notre Dame and the Louvre. The area is the Left Bank; the Latin Quarter. Wonderfull eateries and shops, steps away from the Seine and minutes from all of the area attractions. I though I even saw PaPa Hemingway sitting in a street side cafe. The hotel is a bit pricy but the staff and the location clearly make up for this additional cost, and did I mention you can just walk to numerous sights, the Tower and Arch are a bit far but only a quick cab ride to the downtown area. The people were friendly, unlike what I had heard, and a great deal of them spoke english.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel In Great Location”
Reviews.Author: natsea
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy the left bank and especially the 5th and 6th arrondissements, as well as the Ile de la Cite, Notre Dame, etc, then this is one of the best hotels you can stay in where you'll be close to all of those areas. Very nice hotel, very clean, nice views of Notre Dame from some of the rooms, nice sitting lounge and friendly staff. Internet is free in your room, but you can only get it by plugging in the cord to your computer. If you want wifi, you have to pay for it. Would highly recommend this hotel while in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: wittyanna
Reviews.Content: We went there for 3 days and we had a great time. The room we've booked was very big with huge bathroom. According to the hotel map we have probably booked the biggest room- (premium) which is at the second floor, no.236 but we have paid accordingly (prepare 210 Euro per night, without breakfast). The toiletries in the bathroom are very good, absolutely loved them, especially the body lotion. They should put more every day. The towels are puffy, big and lovely. The bed was huge and very comfy together with 5-6 pillows. Be aware though of the mini bar: it is very expensive...4.5 Euro per 33 cl water. Go and get your water from the supermarket on the corner- 4 min walk. The room was cleaned very well every day. As I said the breakfast wasn't included and we didn't feel like paying 25 Euro per person when there were plenty of bakeries and nice bars on the same road to chose from. The staff was very friendly and they speak good English and Italian. They have given us all the info we've wanted, pointing us on the map how to get there, where to shop, where to eat , where to have good" macarrons". The only thing which definitely has annoyed me was the guys who want to take your luggage. They brought our luggage to the room then he was really taking his time in showing us where the TV was, how to use it, then the air conditioning, the lights, etc...I have never experienced that and I didn't like it at all. He should bring your luggage and "bye". You have to tip him, otherwise he won't leave, would stay there with you all night. This thing has repeated when we left the hotel ,although I told him I can take myself luggage. He absolutely grabbed it from my hand and carried all the way to the taxi. Honestly now,Mr. hotel Manager, give them some manner instructions !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, right by Notre Dame Cathedral in the Left Bank”
Reviews.Author: cfilmcat
Reviews.Content: Best location for spending time in the Left Bank. Steps away from the Bateaubus on the Seine for going to all the great sites on the river. The room was very elegant and the front desk excellent. There is a great breakfast, and a nice quiet bar area for resting after walking around all day.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Friendly, Quaint, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Tarek R
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I are new to visiting Paris, so our review comes without comparison, but we really loved this place. The entrance walking up to the front door of the hotel is as beautiful as the photos. The lobby was well lit, nicely decorated, unassuming (for Louis XIV style) and cozy. We were promptly greeted by a smiling member of the hotel staff at the front desk to check in, and as we began talking he seemed as excited about our visit to the city as we were. He handed us a very good tourist map, gave some pointers about how to navigate the city and after a few minutes we were all checked in. We mentioned we wanted to see a cabaret while we were in town to which they were able to provide some detail about the different shows, and even better we were able to buy our tickets right at the front desk. We were told about breakfast at the hotel, but we really wanted to be out in the city's cafes and the breakfast room wasn't extraordinary, so we never went for it. Another member of staff helped us with our bags as we made or way up the two man elevator to our Superior Room on the 2nd floor. I read a few comments on here about the rooms being small with a bad view, but our room was a good size with an amazing view looking out onto the courtyard of the hotel entrance and onto the neighboring building. So I can't comment on the smaller rooms, but I would suggest booking Superior and asking for a room on the upper floors. For windows, the room had these beautiful french doors that opened up onto the courtyard view, this was probably the best feature of the room. The bathroom was great as well, filled with reddish marble and gold colored fittings, perhaps the best was the peculiar misshapen brass fittings in the tub, beautiful, unique and still completely functional. The bed was comfortable and was always freshly made with chocolates on the pillow when we returned from a day out. Finally the location of the hotel was great, a 5 minute walk to the Notre Dame and three different metro stations, not to mention endless cafe's, shops etc. The best is just walking around the neighborhood, which always felt safe at any time of night. The only downside of the hotel was that there was no wireless internet in the rooms, which I'm told is not uncommon for Paris, but none the less it's the only reason why Melia Colbert didn't receive 5 stars. This place doesn't break the piggy bank, but it's not as cheap as it gets either, for us it was just right, a great value and a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: StephanieW92
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked this hotel for my birthday, because of its central location. Neither of us had been to Paris before, so we didn't know what to expect, but I had heard from friends that hotels were small and claustrophobic. This could not be less true of the Melia Colbert. Our room was spacious, and exquisitely decorated, and every bit as chic as I had hoped it would be! The staff at reception were incredibly polite and helpful, offering plenty of sightseeing advice and directions. I couldn't believe how close were to Notre Dame! The location was fantastic! The only thing I would say, is that the mattresses were ridiculously hard. Other than that, it was true perfection. Plenty of amenities nearby. I would recommend Le Boteille D'Or Restaurant - So good! The Hotel made for a magical weekend, and it was utterly breathtaking!

Reviews.Title: “Location, service and satisfaction.”
Reviews.Author: thomaszabbott
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I came away for her brithday I booked as a surprise and I decided that my research narrowed the choice down the Colbert. We arrived at the hotel and were met warmly by Antonio. Curious, professional and could not do enough to make sure we knew where bistros, sights and shops were. He also upgraded us immediately upon hearing that it was my partner's birthday - to the premier suite no less with the balcony overlooking the front garden. Throughout our stay so far the service has been impeccable. Pay no heed to the negative feedback for this establishment. It is totally unwarranted.

Reviews.Title: “WITHOUT THIS HOTEL, WE WERE LEAVING PARIS!”
Reviews.Author: SarahG1982
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our honeymoon reservations several months in advance of our trip. We arrived at the hotel we originally booked (by the Eiffel Tower) and my husband's allergies immediately started acting up. While in Berlin the week prior, we stayed at Melia Berlin (another five-star experience), so we cancelled our 4 night room reservation and called Melia Colbert to reserve a room. Our initial impression of Paris was not very glamorous -- and we wanted to go back to Munich for the remainder of our honeymoon. Our thoughts and expectations changed as soon as we got to Melia Colbert. The hotel staff is incredibly helpful. The hotel is right around the corner from Notre Dame and within 2 blocks from public transportation. The entire experience of Paris changed by simply staying at Melia Colbert. We utilized the laundry service which arrived back in our room that afternoon. We could not have been happier. If you stay at Melia Colbert, please check our Le Reminat (around the corner - the concierge will give you direction) -- best restaurant in Paris in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Get over it! It's Paris!”
Reviews.Author: clambake33
Reviews.Content: Many people who write reviews about Paris hotels are shocked that the rooms, bathrooms and elevators are small or that the Wi-Fi doesn't work. Get over it! It's Paris! If you want everything in your room, go to Toledo, Ohio and stay at the Hyatt. The reason why the food, the wine, the culture and the beauty of Paris is so fabulous is because for generations the Parisians have been more concerned about those things instead of designing plumbing so you can have a large shower area. This hotel is in a perfect location for tourists (right next to Notre Dame, Latin Quarter and Metro stations), the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The room was very modern, nice and good size (by Paris standards). The bed was a little hard. I can highly recommend it for travelers. One last travel tip - Paris Metro stations ticket machines do not take American credit Cards, so you should buy them on the EuroStar or at the Metro ticket windows.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, but not to stay connected”
Reviews.Author: Darryl M
Reviews.Content: I spent a bit more money than usual on this business trip for the location, space, and amenities that would come with a better level of Paris hotel than I usually stay at. And, in fact, the location is great, just across the river from Notre Dame and a block from the Place Saint Michel. The room I was in (2nd floor front) was clean (not the usual musty Paris hotel smell) and, while not super spacious, I didn't have to climb over the bed to get into the bathroom as I've had to do in some tiny Paris rooms. Despite these positive aspects, I can't recommend this hotel for anyone who uses a macbook air or ipad to stay in touch with business, home, or local events while traveling. The hotel advertises broadband internet access, but it requires that you plug their cable into your computer; if your laptop or ipad doesn't have a LAN port, the best they can offer you is a wired terminal in the bar or wireless access in lobby and bar, and that requires a card with username and password doled out in 30-minute increments by the front desk. When I was there, they ran out of these cards ("Normally we have cards, but as it is the weekend, we cannot get any more", they explained, as if the weekend had come along unexpectedly.) This presented a real barrier to doing the work I needed to do while in Paris, and I overheard other guests at the front desk with the same problem. Instead of shrugging their shoulders and saying "Yes, wi-fi is very bad in Paris", a hotel that charges the rates of this one should--at minimum--have wireless routers that can be borrowed and used in each room by guests who can't connect to the LAN cable. If you don't need to be connected, this is a fine place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “location is good”
Reviews.Author: angie54
Reviews.Content: The sol melia central reservations booking system is the worst I have ever encountered!! It's reason enough not to stay here or at any of their other properties. We needed to remove one day at the end of our stay and the reservation people sent back an entirely wrong confirmation with all the nightly rates changed dramatically. It took a month of back and forth with many more incorrect itineraries and rates trying to modify this properly. They never got it right. I gave up. They do not let you speak with a supervisor. It was the most frustrating experience!!! Since it is a boutique hotel there is no official concierge which made it difficult to get information about transportation, tours, and restaurants that were not in the immediate area etc. They are very short staffed at the check-in desk and the continual problem with the internet not working was annoying. Rooms are very tight and no drawer space whatsoever so we could not upack. They had closets with 2 hangars. Of course we could have called for more but don't they know you need to hang up more than 2 items?? Hotel views were looking into another person's bedroom across the street. One other thing...if you do decide to go to the Hotel and you are taking a taxi make sure you say Rue Hotel Colbert...we said Rue Colbert and that is on the other side of Paris! You would think that on the confirmation they would emphasize that...since they admitted many people get that mixed up!!

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed 4 Star Boutique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: docoliver
Reviews.Content: This property is probably one of the best values in the entire city. First, location, the hotel is just footsteps from Notredame, close to everything in Paris. The property is beautiful and romantic. The rooms are clean, nice, and comfortable. The rooms have all the nice toiletries that you expect from a Melia such as toothbrush, combs, shampoo, conditioner, etc. . I stayed at a superior room and sincerely it was significantly larger and cozier than an equivalent such as the Arc du Triomphe Hilton. The room had windows that actually open to the outside and in our case there were 2 sets, one of which opened to the street and the other to the courtyard. If you like fresh air and waking up to the smell of fresh croissants, this might be the hotel for you. Also, please disregard a previous review that states that the rooms have no air conditioning, they do and it works quite well. Keep in mind, you are paying 250 Euros which is less than average for this type of hotel in Paris. The negatives... Well, there is generally only one attendant at the front desk most of the time, so check-in and check out may be cumbersome if by chance several parties arrive at the same time. These attendants are nice and charming people, they also serve as concierge and really go the extra mile to make you feel at home. The bell service has to be called and can take 5 minutes or so which is beyond what you would wait at a Leading Hotel of the World, but once more, for 250 Euros in Paris, this is outstanding. Bottom-line: I would stay here again without any questions. I found my new home in Paris. Some of the older reviews where likely from prior to the recent renovation so they should be disregarded and the hotel would probably be ranking higher at Tripadvisor if it were not from probably that less glorious epoque.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky place - wonderful location (if you can find it)”
Reviews.Author: Zoespin
Reviews.Content: Steps from Notre Dame, and yet hidden away on a back alley, the Hotel Colbert is a very quirky little place and a great refuge from the mundane after a few days at the Marriott. We did not exactly get the room we asked for, but after a while, it really didn't matter. Our room on the first floor was a bit noisy from people and construction. Nevertheless, the place is warm and has the most wonderful sitting room where you can relax after all of that sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: AndreLALC
Reviews.Content: I have spend four nights in this hotel with my wife on May 2009. The rooms are very cozy, with an excellent bed, although they are not big and the bathroom is really small. Good quality amenities, powerful air conditioning and flat screen television. From our window we could see the top of Notre Dame. The location is just perfect, only a few steps from Notre Dame and really close to St. Germain de Près, Quartier Latin and Les Halles. The hotel exterior is so beautiful that people passing by take pictures of it. I have been to Paris several times and this is the best hotel I have stayed. It is not cheap, but this is the price you have to pay to be in such perfect location in the heart of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: skippy21a
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in Paris and we couldn't have picked a better hotel. Located on the Left Bank near the rue St Germain de Pres, near the Seine, and within a short walk to Notre Dame, this hotel was perfectly located. Our room was clean and comfortable with air conditioning and a small safe for valuables. The bathroom facilities featured a room with bathtub, handheld shower, sink and vanity and a separate small room for the toilet. Every morning, a generous full buffet breakfast was available in the hotel's quaint dining room. Above all, my wife and I found the hotel staff, all of whom speak English well, to be very friendly and very helpful throughout our stay. In this regard, Antonio was exceptionally helpful and courteous, and truly helped to make our stay a very memorable one. We would not hesitate to stay again at the Melia Colbert on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Our New Paris Home”
Reviews.Author: oceaneyyes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful in terms of location, great service, and comfortable, clean rooms. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL, PEACEFUL & DISCREET”
Reviews.Author: Calumb1
Reviews.Content: Booked as part of a Eurostar deal, we were pleasantly surprised with this small but delightful and well presented hotel just behind Notre Dame cathedral on the left bank. Situated in a quiet narrow backstreet with hardly any passing traffic it is very well placed for the local sights. The staff were all welcoming, friendly & helpful, our room was spotlessly clean and comfortable with tasteful decor and all fittings present & working. If any criticism can be made then it would be the price of the (excellent) breakfast at 24 euros a head and drinks in the bar at 30 euros for two gin & tonics. Other than that I would thoroughly recommend this place to visitors who like to enjoy all the local excitement but appreciate a peaceful oasis to retire to at the end of the day. We hope to come back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden treasure”
Reviews.Author: ArmiStan
Reviews.Content: We booked a romantic trip to Paris via Eurostar and the "Melia Colbert Boutique Hotel" was on the list of recommended hotels; we duly researched it and then booked it. We are so pleased we did; it is everything you read in the brochure/online; within easy walking distance of the Paris Metro; down a quaint little side street; beautifully restored and recently redecorated - exceptionally clean -wonderful decor and very professional staff throughout. Our room (33) and was a typical "boutique" style room - slightly small but very adequate; it was well decorated and fresh; the en suite was lovely and the room was all we had expected. This room had the added advantage that we could see one of the large "rose" windows of Notre Dame Cathedral from it. The hotel's location is excellent for those who want to breath in the Paris atmosphere as its within a couple of minuets walk of Notre Dame Cathedral and virtually on banks of the river Seine ; yet within a stones throw of the night life and cafe culture centre of that part of Paris. Basically you could not ask for more We will defiantly be returning to Paris and would have no hesitation in booking at this lovely hotel John and Angie

Reviews.Title: “NO WIFI !!!! - EXCELLENT location.”
Reviews.Author: misspippi
Reviews.Content: Be warned. There is NO WIFI (free or otherwise) to be had in the hotel rooms. If you are like me and travel with a smart phone as your internet access on holiday then the wired internet access is useless. Come on Melia people get your act together and get your wifi sorted. We would also warn that there is NO AIRCON but this is only really a consideration part of the year. If there had been WIFI in the hotel room then my review would be as follows This charming hotel has all the trappings of a five star hotel and my mum and I loved it. It is REALLY close to the Notre Dam church but off the main strip so quiet and peaceful. From here it was literally 2mins walk to the Batobus (the water bus that connects all the best sights of Paris). It is also close to the fabulous restaurants of the Latin Quarter. I highly recommend staying. The first day we were welcomed by the charming Antonio who went to great lengths to answer all of our questions. He had a genuine warmth that was very engaging. Indeed all of the reception staff were exceptional. The room was an average size with a separate toilet which was handy. The finishes of the fittings seemed luxurious but the cleaning was not that great. The stand that the toiletries sit on was smeary and even the plastic entry card just seemed a little grubby too. This is a small issue that I hope this hotel can get right. The bed and the bed linen were amazing. I love a good bed and this was better than some of the 5 star hotels I have stayed in. My mum loved the room decoration. I loved the pillows. The breakfast is OK.. I would not rave about it. Being English at heart I think a good breakfast is essential. This was adequate. The shower and bathroom were very nice. I really really liked the bath products. If they sold the body milk in the reception I would have bought it. My mum used up all of the shower gel so I can't comment on that. Obviously it was pretty good. I loved all of the extras like a toothbrush. I forget mine and this was such a blessing. The towels were big fluffy bathsheets. Lovely. The reception staff were great at recommending local restaurants. The best local ones get booked up so why don't you ask them to book ahead for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff/great location”
Reviews.Author: Sfrh
Reviews.Content: Literally 1 minute from N.D. , Shakespeare and Co. Very close to several Metro lines Only problem is no free WIFI but I was told it was coming soon so ask

Reviews.Title: “boutique hotel close to the Seine”
Reviews.Author: GBest186338
Reviews.Content: An excellent small boutique hotel from the Melia chain located in a quiet side street in the fifth arrondissement close to the Bd St Germain and adjacent to the Seine. The Subway Station is located within approximately 5 minutes walk . Many of the main sites of Paris are within 10 minutes walk including Cathedral Notre Dame, La St Chapelle & Ile St Louis. Housed in a restored former 19th century palace the decor is understated but traditional, the room was well decorated with a small well appointed marble clad bathroom. The local area is fashionable and chic with many excellent brasseries and bars. The highlight however is the hotel staff were extremely helpful & I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful !”
Reviews.Author: sgoldman123
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel thru Continental Vacations. It is 2 blocks from Notre Dame (within view as well). The hotel is quaint and clean. The breakfasts are delicious, and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. After check-in, we received a knock on the door where we found a bellhop with a bottle of champagne. When we told him we didn't order it, he said, (in his best English) no.. it is complimentary. WOW ! As this hotel is in the absolute geographic center of Paris it was extremely convenient. We would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Cozy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 123barrister
Reviews.Content: This is a 39 room hotel that is quite quaint and very pleasant. The staff was very friendly and helpful. It is surrounded by a large number of excellent restaurants. Internet is available for 3 euros for 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Love_generation
Reviews.Content: For long we did not find a good hotel at reasonable price in Paris: this is definitely a good address to know to have an advantageous balance between location, spacious room and central location. The hotel is in a quiet street, just a 100 meters from Notre Dame.

Reviews.Title: “A unique achievement in a BOUTIQUE Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jamwalnit
Reviews.Content: Melia Colbert Boutique Hotel, Paris To be in Paris in itself is a lifetime experience & a memorable one.As I already had a stay with SOLMELIA group hotel in London & Madrid,I never had any second thought in my mind to go for some other hotel when an option was very much available to continue my loyality with the renowned chain. Although the Melia Colbert Boutique Hotel is a small property with only 39 rooms but the elegance of the property in itself is a state of the art. The luxurious Le Colbert Hotel, a magnificent Mansion House of the 19th Century, is strategically located, facing the impressive Cathedral of Notre Dame and close to the Quartier Latin, the famous Louvre museum and the Seine river. Well communicated by train & metro, and close to the International Airports of Orly & Charles de Gaulle. While in Paris, visit as well nearby Versailles and Disneyland Paris. Decorated with elegance and refinement in warm shades, the rooms come equipped with varnished wooden furniture. All the rooms have been renovated. Keeping the tradition of making the guests stay the perfect one,all the details & amenities are very well taken care of. Since there are not a lot of options to choose from for the dining part but the restaurant of the hotel won't upset you & the food itself even let anyone down as the taste & quality are the fields where no compromises are made.Above of all the staff themselves will put all the efforts to make you at ease during the whole stay. During the spare time while being in the hotel,the lounge is at the disposal of the guests with a library & varieties of snacks & drinks available. This hotel is truly recommended due to its location,services & quality standards as to the tradition of the brand.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully located - a short walk away from Paris's great sights and landmarks”
Reviews.Author: goabum
Reviews.Content: A charming boutique hotel with excellent, friendly service (rare in Paris!) The front desk staff were ever willing to help out with directions, restaurant advice and general information. When I slept in and missed the buffet breakfast the staff immediately laid out coffee, juice and pastries to tide me over. The location is perfect - step out and you're on the banks of the Seine opposite Notre Dame, ready to walk past some of the greatest sights of the most gorgeous city on earth! I only wish the internet was free, something I believe all hotels should provide today. But there was an excellent (paid) broadband connection in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Minny011
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel near Notre Dame, the rooms were modern and clean. The breakfast also very diverse. The neighbourhood is very nice with meny shops, cafes and restaurants. We had a very nice walk from the hotel all the way to the Arc de Triumph, passing by the cathedral of Notre Dame, Louvre and the Champs-Elysees.

Reviews.Title: “Right up our street”
Reviews.Author: dewickm
Reviews.Content: Very cute hotel near Notre Dame tucked away down a quiet back street but close to loads of bars and restaurants. Brilliant location. We had a small but cute room with a partial view of the spires of the cathedral. Got a half price deal on breakfast by joining the Melia Hotel loyalty club card. All the staff very friendly and helpful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Start, fine Ending”
Reviews.Author: marjNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: When we arrived exhausted, Hotel Colbert staff offered us the worst room in lthe house, Chambre 1, which had painted over window that opened to the pavement inches away. But thanks to the presence of a long time American guest, we were then offered Chambre 37, which was fine with a view of the flowered courtyard. The hotel is very well located, the staff is pleasant, the atmosphere is relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, very French, great location”
Reviews.Author: liviBoston
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty, well-kept, boutique hotel in a great location. Our room, while small, was beautifully appointed and had a partial view of Notre Dame. Staff is friendly and helpful. Breakfast delicious -- especially the croissants.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in fabulous location.”
Reviews.Author: savma
Reviews.Content: this is a lovely hotel.staff very friendly and helpful.rooms clean and tastefully decorated.bathrobes and slippers provided,also great selection of complimentary toiletries.notre dame cathedral at the end of this quiet street and numerous cafes/restaurants within minutes of the hotel.would love to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Darling hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: kellycares
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just spent 6 nights at the Melia Colbert 2 weeks ago. The hotel is in a fabulous location--on a quiet street just steps away from Notre Dame, the Metro, and the Left Bank shops and restaurants. I was so pleased with the location. I have stayed in other areas of the city before, mostly on the right bank. I will always try to stay in this area again on future stays. The hotel was not full, so they gave us a complimentary upgrade to a junior suite. Also, we signed up as Melia frequent guest members and got our breakfast at half price. The upgraded room included free internet. Without the upgrade, the internet was 7 euro per hour--a price I thought was ridiculously high. The rooms were fine. I would not call them spacious, but they were not overly small either. There were no dressers and my friend and I both had to live out of our suitcases, unfortunately. The beds were rock hard, but we were so exhausted at the end of the day that we slept well anyway. The bathrooms look nice, but on close examination, the "marble" on the floor and walls was made of laminate. The rooms were very clean. I would rate the rooms a "3" star. This is what I expected, so I was fine with it. The breakfast was tasty and fresh. We just had the continental breakfast each day as the hot breakfast selections were limited and did not seem worth the extra cost. The cappuccinos were delicious! What made our trip so special, however, was the staff. The front desk staff--Monika and Antonio, and the breakfast room attendant, Rosemarie, gave use excellent service. The staff went out of their way to be helpful and always had a smile on their faces.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Boutique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sofiachara
Reviews.Content: A beautiful boutique hotel with very pretty bedrooms. Well located and just a few minutes walk to Notre Dame. The staff, especially the Hotel Manager were very friendly and helpful. Would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Left Wanting”
Reviews.Author: TXNN312
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked at the Melia Colbert Hotel for late November, 2010. It has a great location. From some of the rooms, you can see Notre Dame. The first room we were booked in had a broken safe, so the staff was very nice to move us to another room for the remainder of the stay. The room that they moved us to was obviously a smokers room, although we had specifically asked for a non-smoking room. Housekeeping's answer to that was to find all the windows were open when we came back for the evening. Some nights, we found that the bed was only partially made up. After mentioning it to several of the staff with no results, I found the linen closet open in the hall and finished making the bed up myself. It has the potential to be a very nice hotel, but the effort was not heartfelt.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with friendly ,helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: flower-37
Reviews.Content: We were two women staying here. Location was great and convenient to sight seeing and the Metro. Although the hotel is on a quiet side street, the area is lively and busy into the night. Staff could not have been nicer or more accommodating. My only problem was with the uncomfortable mattresses. I should have asked if something could be done but I didn't. My fault. I would recommend this hotel very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel with superb location”
Reviews.Author: akoor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Melia Colbert for 6 nights .his was our second visit since 2007 and the hotel has undergone significant remodeling since we had last been there several years ago. The hotel is located steps from the Quai Montebello on a small quiet side street. For us the location was perfect (5 minute walk to the St Michel Metro station in the shadow of Notre Dame). The staff was efficient friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and comfortable. Overall we were very pleased and have no real criticisms. We will most definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “not as great as a few years ago”
Reviews.Author: Fabiolaabu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel a few years ago. The hotel was special to us because its where we were engaged. We were really excited to return but were slightly dissapointed. This past visit the paint was peeling off the walls and ceilings and the hotel was slightly worn looking.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,in great location!”
Reviews.Author: Mamasboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Melia April 6,7,8 2010.Our purpose of our trip to Paris was the site's and sound's of the city.I wanted a location close to the Metro,clean,and comfortable,close to all. We flew into CDG,took the RER to St.Michel stop,took the ELEVATOR up to ground,with 3 big pieces of luggage,important if you are traveling from the airport!!NO STAIRS TO CLIMB!!walked out on to the street,no more than a 5 min walk to the hotel.Perfect!! The Melia is a lovely little hotel with charm and character of it's own.The staff were all very accommodating,they all did a great job,we felt at home.The room was well appointed,with all toiletries,very comfortable bedding,in a non smoking room,overlooking the courtyard.2 min. walk to Notre Dame.Bakery's,restaurant's,all close at hand! All in All,LOVELY,would definitely go again! regard's

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, didn't want to leave.”
Reviews.Author: monkeytravellersUk
Reviews.Content: This hotel just screams Paris!! It is a beautiful mansion house hotel and the rooms are pure Paris. You really feel like you are in a unique room in a unique city. Sure, they are a little bit faded-glory but that is part of the charm. If you want a bog-standard chain hotel with every room bland and standardised...then go and stay in one and leave the charming places to those of us with taste! This is a true Parisian hotel in an amazing location - just a very short stroll from the Latin Quarter and the best places to be in Paris. One street from Notre Dame (could see it from our window) Masses of places to eat and to see and be seen. Perfect place to stay with a teenager in tow. A short stroll from the Metro and from the buzzing restaurant district, yet the rooms were so peaceful and quiet at night. The rooms were spotless and the staff wonderful and helpful but without being intrusive. Can't recommend it enough and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff but facilities in need of a renovation”
Reviews.Author: misterbitterpants
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here recently, wasn't our first choice for hotels in Paris but circumstances put us there so we made the most of it. All the staff we met were fantastic and made the stay enjoyable but unfortunately the building and rooms were very much in need of an upgrade. Hall carpet was threadbare, bathroom fixtures were tarnished and some were even half coming off (i had to screw the shower head holder back into the wall). Wear spots on the walls, chipped paint, peeling wallpaper, etc. The decor is not at all contemporary. Not sure how to describe it as its not french antique, its just kinda... old. The rooms are Parisian-sized (aka small) and getting into the nook the toilet is in requires a fair bit of dexterity. Wi-fi is not free. The hotel is located a short walk from the Maubert Mutalitie metro stop and we could see a sliver of Notre Dame from our window. Lots of shopping and little eateries nearby on Boul Saint Jacques and Boul Saint Germaine.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - we loved it.”
Reviews.Author: mestable37
Reviews.Content: Many reviewers note that the bathrooms and/or rooms are a little small...you are in Europe people! Europe! I've traveled all over Europe, and I thought our room was great. We did splurge on one of the nicest rooms since it was our honeymoon...but we loved it. Clean, well decorated, quiet, comfortable, romantic. They even had champagne waiting for us when we arrived. And, it is just a block or so from Notre Dame, walks on the Seine, near the Latin Quarter, and there are great bars just over in Odeon not more than about 15-20 minute walk. Great location!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: In the countryside, west of London, England
Reviews.Title: “Good option if you want to stay near Notre Dame”
Reviews.Author: Lynn of Berkshire
Reviews.Content: We were going to Paris to meet old friends who were staying in an apartment in this area, which is why I looked for a hotel near Notre Dame. Normally I prefer to stay nearer the Opera or Les Halles. I booked the hotel as part of a Eurostar package with Lastminute.com. We were pleased with the hotel: the staff were friendly and helpful, it was bright, welcoming and comfortable. The "double" bed was two singles pushed together, with separate bed linen on each, which is annoying but not unusual, unfortunately. As other reviewers have mentioned, the bathroom and toilet facilities were a bit cramped, and I noticed some worn carpet, etc., but this really wasn't too important and, in my experience, is not unusual in a central Paris hotel unless you are prepared to pay really serious amounts of money. I probably wouldn't want to stay here for a week, but for our one night, it was just fine and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WrldtravlrBoston
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Melia Colbert was excellent! The staff was professional, personable, and fluent in English. The hotel was quaint, quiet, and in a perfect location. Rooms were small, but clean and comfortable. The breakfast price seemed too high - any of the hundreds of cafes close by were easy to walk to.

Reviews.Title: “cozy”
Reviews.Author: RifkaRM
Reviews.Content: A great small hotel, practically besides NotreDame (though there is no view towards it) its a peaceful retreat, the rooms are nice and clean and the staff is particularly friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: francofille12
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for somewhere to stay on the Left Bank that is right in the thick of things, this is the place. It is literally two blocks from the Seine and Notre Dame and yet it's set back on a quite side street so you don't get noise of drunk hooligans from the Boule Mich waking you up at 4 AM. I think it's important to realize when reading other reviews that what you are really paying for in this hotel is the location...because I agree that is was a little shabby for its 4 star designation. My experience with the customer service was mostly positive. I arrived very early in the morning since I flew direct from the East Coast of the US and yet I was promptly checked in and shown to my room since they had one available. I even let the guy convince me to upgrade to a Superior Room since I wanted constant internet access and it came for free at this level of room. I had a very positive experience with this clerk but some of the others were a little dour. All of the bellhops were universally nice, however, and very friendly and eager to help. I was pleased with the size of my room although the bed wasn't great...it was basically the size of a king but it was two doubles pushed together. For those who complain about the size of the bathroom, etc. I think we have to put everything in context: this is Paris...space is at a huge premium...I am not small (standard issue "big boned american") and I had to squeeze to shut the door...but why let it ruin your trip? I didn't come to Paris to be able to relieve myself in a palace. Also, all commenters are right about the breakfast: it's good but horrifically overpriced considering the wealth of other options in the neighborhood. Another curious thing about the hotel is that most of the staff and many of the patrons when I was there were Spanish speaking...I'm not sure if this is because it's owned by a Spanish company or if it's just happenstance....certainly didn't bother me as the staff also spoke french and english...For spanish tourists or spanish speaking tourists, this would be a great place to stay. To help put my comments in context: I came for personal reasons for a five day visit at the beginning of December...was traveling alone, have lived in France before and visited Paris many, many times staying at all different classes of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star? You must be joking!”
Reviews.Author: podstephens
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this hotel before, about 5 years ago, and thought then that it was a nice hotel in a really great location but was badly in need of redecoration. We usually go to Paris for New Year but this year I left it quite late to book and there wasn't much available in the right location so I booked this hotel again, especially as it states on one of the websites I looked at that it had been completely renovated recently. Not in the last 5 years it hasn't! We booked and paid for a Superior Room but were told on arrival that there were no Superior rooms available. We were told that we had been allocated a standard room with an especially wonderful view of Notre Dame instead and were to be refunded 20E per night. At such a busy time we knew there was no point in looking elsewhere so accepted it. When we got to the room I couldn't believe the size of the bathroom and toilet - you had to squeeze yourself up against the toilet cistern just to get the door shut and it was like being entombed once you closed the door. The bed was uncomfortable (you could feel the springs poking through) and the "especially wonderful view of Notre Dame" was a tiny slice through the gap in the buildings. Carpets throughout the hotel were totally threadbare (I even took photos I was so amazed that they had the gall to keep the hotel open like that) and there were scabby old rugs dotted around everywhere to hide the worst areas. There were water stains on the walls and a general air of delapidation throughout. We were told that breakfast would be 28E per person and I do remember from the first visit that breakfast was ok but certainly not worth well over £50 for two! Needless to say, we gave it a miss this time. And when we checked out the 60 Euro refund went down to 41 Euros as I'd had a bag of crisps and a tiny bar of chocolate from the mini-bar. Some of the staff were really friendly but the front desk staff didn't seem to care whether we lived or died in their hotel. With complete renovation and interested staff this hotel would be worthy of it's 4 Stars as it is a beautifull building and the location is really good, but as it is I wouldn't give it 2 Stars. In fact it really needs to be closed down for renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointing!”
Reviews.Author: Adelfius
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our 3 days honeymoon in Paris, because a friend of us said it was his favourite hotel in Paris and it had a great location. He used to go there very often about 3 years ago for work. But it seems these 3 years have been very long for the Colbert Hotel, because what we saw and exerienced was very far from a standart 4 star hotel. We paid 250 Euros per night without breakfast thinking that the hotel would worth it. We arrived at the hotel late at night and as other people say, nobody came out to help us with the luggage. We thought something wasn't right from the very beginning. The reception area looks old but charming in a way, the lift was a minimal cage that nearly couldn't fit my partner and me with luggage. The carpets at the corridos were half gone and the whole hotel had the typical smell of a low backpacker. When we entered the room, I couldn't believe it. Dark, super small bed, very dirty and with terrible humidity spots wall paper. It was so dissapointing. We were hoping to spend 3 days in a beautiful hotel and that was much worse than some motels I've been. We didn't even wait to see the bathroom or open our luggage and we came down to reception to ask if that was a joke. The kind o teenager at reception told us the hotel was fully booked and could give us another room. We only stayed there because it was 1am and we didn't want to spend our honeymoon wondering around the streets. Next morning the manager called us to our room and said the hotel was being slowly renovated, but because it is an old historic building they needed special permits for that and it was all very expensive. He changed our room and gave us breakfast for free. The new room was very small, but at least it looked like we were in Paris, not in a road motel in deep Rusia. The bathroom was spotless and had loads of those silly toiletries. Breakfast was just ok and served in a cave at the cellar. I prefer natural light, but I have to recognize that for those with an interest in old historic buildings it had an atmosphere. The whole hotel had a special atmosphere really. The building is beautifull, but it really needs a complete renovation. The manager was nice with us, but the staff at reception wasn't very professional. They all looked more like students in practice. Our expectations very high on this hotel, because of what we had heard, so we were vey dissaponted when we got there. The location is perfect, and the hotel is quite cheap for a "4 star" in the center of Paris. But this shouldn't be a 4 star in my opinion and doesn't worth the money it costs. I'm sure there are other not so historic famous hotels in the area with much better rooms, cleaner and so much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!! Keep looking for another hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LexBeach
Reviews.Content: My husband and I did a lot of research on hotels before selecting a hotel in Paris. We were confirmed at the Melia Colbert for a Superior room, which has more space than some of their other room options. However, on arrival just before their official check-in time at noon, we were told that no Superior rooms were available and that we could take the smaller Standard room or we could go to their sister hotel in a distant locationthe shower, and that room feels like a shoebox. . We were quite unhappy with these options as room size and location were our two biggest factors for choosing a hotel. The room felt like a closet! The room with the toilet (separate from the bathroom) was like a human shoebox. The mattress was also very uncomfortable - you could feel the springs. Also, while the hotel advertises internet access, this was not available. I called the reception and was told that the internet access was broken and my option was to go to a nearby cafe. That's exactly what I want to do on my trip to Paris - carry my computer around looking for internet access! The next day we moved to the Renaissance Hotel in the 1st Arrondisement - Excellent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dsevcenko
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend spent 3 nights at Melia Colbert Boutique Hotel and we didnt have a single complaint! It definitely made our time in Paris even more pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: TampaRyan
Reviews.Content: My husband, 14-year-old son and I stayed at the Melia Colbert for 5 nights in June, 2009. This was my second stay here. My husband and I also brought our older son here when he was 10, in 1999, and I was so happy to be able to return to the Colbert. This is the best European hotel I've ever stayed in, and I've vacationed in Europe 8 times. I have stayed in larger, more expensive, more luxurious hotels in Europe, but the service was poor. At the Melia Colbert, the hotel is small, and the staff recognize you when you come in the door. They know you, and are eager to help. The hotel is in a great location. It is on a quiet side street, but only 3 blocks from the St. Michel Metro station, which has connections to other subway lines and the RER, so you can take the train directly to and from Charles de Gaulle Airport (one-way fare was 25 euros for the three of us, versus at least 60 euros for a taxi). For breakfast (if you don't want to pay 25 euros per person in the hotel) a little grocery store and bakery with fresh croissants is only a block away behid the hotel. You can store food in the minibar refrigerator. I have had the best night's sleep in Europe at the Melia Colbert, both in 1999 and 2009. In fact, I still dream of sleeping at the Colbert, it's so wonderful! The beds are very comfortable and the location, about 1-1/2 blocks off the Quai de Montebello (the street that runs along the left bank of the Seine) is quiet. The bathrooms are very comfortable and functional, too, and as an American, I especially appreciate the glass-enclosed shower with a door. In most European hotels, you're lucky if you get a little glass panel next to the shower,and it's easy to spray the entire bathroom when taking a shower. At the Colbert, the shower is totally enclosed. The bathrooms also have a towel-warmer rack, which not only makes the towels nice and warm, it's also very handy for drying laundry! It can be hard finding a hotel in Paris that can accomodate 3 people in a room for a reasonable price, but the Colbert managed it for us in 1999 with a rollaway cot in a large double room, and in 2009 with a junior suite that had a bedroom and living room with a day bed on the fourth floor under the eaves. It was very cosy and charming, plus you can see the towers of Notre Dame out the window (and hear the bells)! The price at the Melia Colbert is $100-$200 higher per night than the large chain hotels on the wide, noisy Blvd. St. Germain, but it is quiet and tucked away, with genuine Parisian charm. Just pay the extra money and enjoy this wonderful hotel experience, it is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Solid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: closetrat
Reviews.Content: Very nice staff. Helpful as well. I had no problem with my bags. The dude with the last post about not getting help with his bags probably should have asked for help. The only negatives were the price, but nothing is cheap right now in Paris and from what my friends have told me, the price was actually not unreasonable. So don't judg them on this. The rooms were a bit 'old' and 'tattered' but not enough to bother me or my girlfriend. The bathroom seemed brand new. Decent size room overall. Internet worked perfectly. The location was phenomenal. I definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid staying here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Relaxseeker
Reviews.Content: When you arrive to this hotel you will notice NOBODY will come out to help you with the luggage, why? Because they are under staff. When I arrived, after me and my girlfriend carried all luggage, a supposed Bellman appears, he was doing something else inside. The same when we left. That's nothing, as you know, nowadays access to the internet is mandatory since modern tourist use the web to check out places to go, restaurant, reserve tours, and since this wannabe 4 stars hotel, which is not, doesn't have a CONCIERGE, we need the internet, but it WASNT WORKING and they didn't know what to do, come on it's the 21st Century, when I asked to speak to a manager on duty, it wasn't any. Why? Because it's just an INN it's no way this piece of junk could be a four star hotel. A underwear of my girlfriend was stolen, and again NO MANAGER. Avoid this place, the service sucks, they stole from you, no bellman, the breakfast 38 EUROS, come on!!! I prefer to go to FAUCHON to have breakfast for the same price, very small rooms and NO INTERNET. I really do not understand in what standards this could be four stars, in the states would be a one star Inn. KEEP AWAY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Candice21
Reviews.Content: We had travelled overnight from the Middle East and after the lack of order experienced at the airport, to be collected by the hotel shuttle and to be greeted by friendly and accommodating staff when travelling with a 21month old was simply, DELIGHTFUL They were able to check us in early which was the cherry on the cake - the trip continued with the same theme when talking about our hotel. Rooms were comfortable and quiet. My only negative comment was that the air con didnt work - but I live in the desert and we need it to survive. I would not bother with the breakfasts as for a fraction of the price and 20 steps outside you can enjoy all of the Parisan cafe's all around.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Mportilho
Reviews.Content: This place is a very Parisian style boutique hotel. Cosy, charming and well located. We are definitely coming back. The boulangerie close to the hotel serves an outstanding pain au chocolat and delicious croissants. Very close to the Notre Dame church and nice places to visit and eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “i loved it, but there are "buts"”
Reviews.Author: opera1
Reviews.Content: perfect location, and wonderful front desk and doorman. BUT the air conditioning did NOT work the two nights we were there, the clothes storage space is virtually non-existent, And even a careful shower by a fairly small person required 4 towels to mop up the floor. You also risked life and limb getting out of a very slippery tub. The breakfast, even at the "bargain"rate of 19 euros, was not at all lavish or interesting or delicious, and I don't like to begin my day in a cave. The area is chock-a-block with both cafes for breakfast and really wonderful non-commercial restaurants. Except for the price and perhaps a bit tired decor, I would happily return here.

Reviews.Title: “Great find of a hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Matt W
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I found this hotel to be excellent - the location, just one street from the River Seine and Notre Dame was perfect - it was a few minutes walk to the Batobus river stop, which is a great way of getting around the main attractions in Paris. Its also near the metro and only a short ride on the Metro to Gare de Nord (Eurostar arrivals). The local area is very lively, with many bars, cafes and restaurants. The hotel itself is in a quiet street and is impressive as you arrive, with a small courtyard in front. The reception staff were friendly and when we arrived early (11.30 am ish), they were able to sort out a room earlier than the planned checkin and looked after our luggage when we did some sightseeing. As it was raining, they offered us an umbrella to take with us which was a thoughful gesture. The rooms were not a bad size and there was a nice bathroom with a bath. We had heard the breakfast was quite expensive, so didn't eat there, but very near the hotel was some bakery and patisserie shops, so we didn't go hungry ! The hotel was booked through the Lastminute.com and their hidden hotels feature (it was easy to work out from googling the description which hotel it was, so we got a good price of £117 per night. Would certainly recommend to leisure visitors to Paris who want a nice hotel near the key sites.

Reviews.Title: “Perferct”
Reviews.Author: glasgowAyr
Reviews.Content: A Absolute hidden gem of a hotel,central to everything,thoroughly recommended...

Reviews.Title: “Big bang for your buck......”
Reviews.Author: ms1972
Reviews.Content: Booked this through Lastminute as one of the top secret hotels and got for about 160 yoyos per night. Location was 100% based 30 seconds from Notre Dame off a little quiet street. Hotel was top class, admittedly the rooms a little tired, maybe this is French Shabby Chic but we only slept in the room so this did not bother us one bit. Price a tad high also but not bad for Paris, breakfast €28 (cop on) even with a Melia card it still meant 14 each!!!! No thanks guys..... Staff excellent, kind courtious and a pleasure to deal with. Even to the point when I asked the night porter/receptionist where to get a packet of smokes late at night, he said it would be a good 10 minute walk so kindly gave me his box of cigarettes. Rue de Rivoili shopping 5 minute walk across the NOtre Dame bridge, Latin Qrt on your doorstep, Louvre a good 15 minte walk. We even walked to the Eiffel Tower a good 45 minutes. Eating must recommend the Latin Qrt for price friendly restaurants, happy hour in the pubs 5 - 9pm mean a pint is €4 and not €8! Will be back here in a flash as 3 days in Paris is not enough, have found a great base in Melia Colbert and this will be my first port of call.

Reviews.Title: “Return To Excellence”
Reviews.Author: amortizor73
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for our ninth time at this gem of a hotel in April, 2009. Last year I wrote a somewhat critical review of the establishment as it needed some improvements. This year was a return to excellence. The hotel has installed HD flat panel TVs in the rooms and the selection of stations has been expanded. They have upgraded the facilities in the breakfast cove and there are other signs of attention to details. (The price of breakfast increased 17% to 28 euros, however.) The staff also seems to have improved. This hotel is in a fabulous location and has returned to excellence.

Reviews.Title: “almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: chloerbn
Reviews.Content: the hotel melia colbert keeps up to its four stars qualification. its location can't be any better: right next to notre dam. the hotel has a lovely french style and the room are beautifully decorated although the are a little small and there is no proper room for the bagages. the only other inconvinient was the toilet wich is divided into two rooms one foe bathing and the other is the toilet. the thing is the toillet is too small and has no ventilation so there can be somo troble with the smell. apart from that the hotel was flawlees. its has little details such as having jars of scented water also the staff is very nice and they speak spanish.

Reviews.Title: “rip-off tourist tax that last minute.com forgot to mention!”
Reviews.Author: jwales497
Reviews.Content: Excellent location but room in the eaves was in keeping with the quasimodo theme,a hunchback would have had difficulty using the shower. On checkout our friends were charged nine euros for a three night stay,"tourist tax" but when my husband questioned this we were only charged six euros! Have travelled extensivley in europe and never encountered this make it up as you go along tax before

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Johnny1032
Reviews.Content: I recently stay at this lovely little gem and would recommend it to anyone. Small, very friendly and with superb location for sightseeing, restaurants, etc. I got an excellent deal, and would stay here again in a heartbeat if I could get the same rate. I would hesitate to pay the full rate though. Breakfast is very overpriced, although oddly the room service version in much better value and was much enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Don't take a taxi”
Reviews.Author: CrestaRider
Reviews.Content: At this price range, in Central Paris, I expect a small bed in a small room with a smaller bathroom. My standard room on the first floor was a joy. It was small, but clean and well decorated, with great high windows which let in plenty of light. The bathroom had a seperate WC and the shower worked well. The reception staff were great and we really enjoyed our four night stay. The only thing missing was any hot drinks making facilities. One source of amusement is taking a taxi to the hotel. If a taxi driver hasn't heard of the hotel then he obviously won't have heard of the street it's in, (Rue de Hotel Colbert). The conversation goes something like this: "Hotel Colbert, please" "Errr...what street is it in?" "It's in Rue de Hotel Colbert" "Yes, but whats's the street called?" "It's called RUE DE HOTEL COLBERT. Look it up on your sat-nav" "My sat-nav dosn't have hotels only streets" "Fine, take me to Notre Dame"

Reviews.Title: “Best Location; Worst Staff”
Reviews.Author: Connvinced
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Melia Colbert before and were looking forward to going back. We booked 2 regular rooms and a suite for ourselves and extended family for several nights before Christmas. As we expected, the location cannot be beat....quiet street, a few blocks from the Latin Quarter, Notre Dame, Saint Chappelle, Shakespeare & Co., etc. The rooms were as we expected....nicely decorated, but smallish and beginning to look a little tired (but not too bad). However, we were completely unprepared for the surliness of the staff. Well, perhaps I should say SOME staff. If they would fire the dark haired girl who mans the front desk, it would probably solve 90% of their bad reviews. She was unwilling to communicate basic facts (where is the parking garage (around the corner via a convoluted set of one way streets), do you have a sewing kit (no)0 even though they were asked politely in respectable French. We had the sense that the hotel had been overrun by Americans over the recent years and several staff were only grudgingly willing to wait on them. Porters are hard to come by and the hotel is tight, so luggage transport to rooms is hit or miss. The hotel is also about a 2 star when it comes to out of the ordinary requests...extra pillow, iron, etc. This is a shame, because a few years ago they could not have tried harder. The breakfast room in the cellar is worth seeing for its quaintness, but definitely overpriced with so many other options in the neighborhood. If you need a suite, we were in room 54, which had two rooms, two tvs, a generous bath, and dormer windows with a view of the Notre Dame towers. It was great for a family of 4. If the company running this hotel reads the reviews, my suggestion is to give your staff sensitivity training and up the customer service and then, together with its magnificent location and passable rooms, the Melia Colbert will be able to command much higher rates and people will leave much happier.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...Very Shabby Treatment...”
Reviews.Author: crazymario
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the hotel the desk tried to pass off a " standard" room as superior... Asking for another room the grouchy woman AGAIN tried to pass off a standard room as superior... When i told her I had STAYED at the hotel before and would be happy to show her the room description on the net she very grudgingly gave us the superior room we had BOOKED and payed for months in advance. For the rest of our stay she greeted us with outright rudness and hostility. There is no concierge service evidently as my repeated email requests for advice for a nice restaurant for Christmans Eve and day were met with indifference. I finally bought a Michelin guide and had them reserve tables for us.. or so I thought... on 2 nights the restaurants claimed they had NO reservation. If we had not arrived early we would not have been seated. The room was ok... The wallpaper looked as if it had been attacked witha knife however and the door to the toilet almost impossible to open.. Although clean looking it smelled strongly of mildew. Good points: Great location nand nice portier and room service lady..( even though the room was not cleaned until late afternoon on a couple of occassions. Sad to see such a nice property so BADLY run... A shame really... TIP: Avoid the 26 Euro breakfast and buy your juice , coffee and croissant TO GO from the bakery a couple of doors down.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: hermitcrabFrance
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location, very central near Notre Dame but in a quiet street. We were able to walk to decent restaurants with ease. The hotel is decorated in Louis X1V style (well, Colbert was his finance minister so that makes sense) which is a bit over the top for me. The rooms were comfortable and quiet with decent bathrooms. We paid for a superior room.Breakfast was expensive, 26 euros but very good, except that the coffee was always stewed. There was a very noisy generator in the only public room [-] bar, I think it was running the fridge. There is a small lift to the bedroom floors, but a rather tricky staircase down to the vaulted cellar room which is the breakfast room. Excellent staff overall

Reviews.Title: “Tired little gem”
Reviews.Author: travelling_slow
Reviews.Content: Yes the Hotel needs a refurbishment, but you cannot beat the location and the friendly staff. We had a superior room (38) which had views of the butresses of Notre Dame. Room was clean & very presenatble. Street outside quiet at night, though delivery lorries & dustbin men mean you don't need to set the alarm. Apparently the hotel is due a major refurbishment by it's new owners (Melia Group) so maybe it will be better, but maybe it will loose some charm. Tip would be that if your rate does not include breakfast, then join the Solmelia.com Rewards before arrival and get 1 breakfast free.

Reviews.Title: “Small but Good”
Reviews.Author: chef082
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. It's in the Latin Quater in Paris, and in my opinion, the best area to stay in the city. The hotel is small. Small bathroom, small bedroom, small everything. But it is comfortable, extremely clean and very charming. The frontdesk attendants were very kind and actually from this planet, which can be difficult to find in Paris. The service was very fast and very good. I had to pay for the internet, bit of a downer. Overall, happy and will return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Shabby, Worn Out. Stay Elsewhere!!”
Reviews.Author: OenophileNJ
Reviews.Content: We were hugely disappointed with the shabby appearance, poor maintenance, and general appallingly low quality of the Hotel Colbert. At the price of 300 Euros (U.S. $430 at the current exchange) for what was billed as a “superior” room, especially, it was more than a disappointment: it was really, well, a ripoff. This is the only honest way to put it. Some of the specific things we found unacceptable and frankly distasteful include burned lampshades in the bar, threadbare carpets on the stairs and throughout the hotel. All the guest room and common area furniture was old, worn and the upholstery was often even dirty. The carpet in the breakfast room was absolutely filthy, and was worn down to threads even in the lobby and bar areas. The fabric and padding were entirely torn from the arm of an ornamented sofa in the lobby, and there was a huge tear in the rather dirty fabric. As for conditions in our room, we could not even read our tourist guides at night given the tiny lamps (and dust-covered bulbs) and resulting dim lighting. The wallpaper in our guest room was gouged in places and speckled with what looked like plaster patching stains. Our "queen" bed was really just two beds pushed together, but without the "joiner," and there were literally two sets of linen so that my wife and I couldn't actually share the bed. Not exactly a romantic arrangement for a Paris holiday. The tiny, 19-inch TV’s very presence was absurd for Anglos, as the hotel does not subscribe to any English-language programming, which I found incredible in a Paris hotel generally, and especially one patronized by lots of English and American visitors. It also contrasted notably with a friend’s two-star hotel that included a flat-screen TV and BBC with CNN International programming. The bathroom looked nice, as other reviewers have noted, but was a disaster to use and the tub (with no shower curtain and hence a flooded room every morning and evening) was two feet off the floor, making it difficult and even unsafe to enter or exit. This hotel has a good location on the Left Bank, in the shadow of the Cathedral of Notre Dame. That is about the only positive aspect; except for one gentleman at the front desk, ironically of Spanish descent, the staff was not friendly or helpful. For example, we did not get our wakeup call the first morning, with no apology or explanation. The Colbert has no concierge, so we asked the haughty “gentleman” at the front desk to make two restaurant reservations, arrange a trip to Versailles, and arrange a dinner at one of the famous Paris “revues” Either he did nothing or didn’t leave any note of it, as he was off the next day, requiring us to ask for all the same arrangements over again with the next person on duty. This hotel, remarkably, has a 4-star rating, but probably deserves a 2-star rating at best. It is reminiscent of many 2-star hotels I stayed in to save money when I was a student, 20 years before. It badly needs a major investment in furniture, carpet, wall coverings and general furnishings, and frankly a good cleaning and a management that cares. This one does not. The Hotel Le Colbert has clearly been neglected. In short – it’s a seedy, inaccurately rated, poorly maintained and grossly overpriced establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, could have been better & worse”
Reviews.Author: VeryTiredDad
Reviews.Content: The staff & location can't be beat. A short walk (1/4 mile?) to the metro & Notre Dame. Rooms were clean & bed was nice. Our room was also very quiet. The showers have this weird telephone thing that doesn't stay up on the wall and you have to hold it over your head, very annoying & next time we will make sure the hotel has American type showers. Also, the breakfast is good, BUT IS NOT INCLUDED IN THE PRICE OF THE ROOM!!!! We were never told this. It is an above average buffet with good coffee, but not good enough to cost 25 EUROS PER PERSON!!! Ridiculous. I probably would not stay here again, but I did like the place, except for the overpriced breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Central but quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Le_Dap
Reviews.Content: Le Colbert is a charming hotel on a quiet street just steps away from the bustle of the Seine and Notre Dame. Our room was well proportioned but had a rather small bathroom and separate WC. Our bed was comfortable and in spite of the very central location we had a restful night. There are a number of very good restaurants nearby. We went with friends to Atelier Maitre Albert, which serves pleasant rotisserie food but is somewhat lacking in sparkle. We hoped for a drink in the hotel bar with our friends afterwards but were disappointed to find that the comfortable-looking bar closed at 10.00 p.m. We ordered a taxi from the receptionist the following morning to take us to Gare de Lyon but she failed to obtain one in time and we had to march our cases to a taxi rank near Place St Michel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NCtourist
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights at the beginning of a two week stay in France. The most desireable feature of the hotel is its location. Our room on the "first" floor (actually the second) looked out to a view of the towers of Notre Dame. The service at the hotel was quite good. We were relocated promptly and efficiently by the staff when we requested a king bed instead of the standard bed in our first assigned room. The new room was small but very nicely decorated. Umbrellas were provided when we left for dinner in a spring shower. Staff were always pleasant and helpful. The breakfast was outstanding in the hotel. It was served in a lovely room with vaulted stone ceiling and had excellent choices for all tastes. The hotel is so convenient for visiting all the sites on the Left Bank and is an easy walk to the many restaurants in the area. We would definitely make this choice again on a future trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Hot Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TnTraveler07
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the week of April 24, 2007. This is a lovely hotel and well located but it has some issues that you should be aware of. During our five night stay the air conditioning was off for two hot days and nights. With the windows open it was only just bearable because of the heat, the floodlights on the front of the hotel, and the noises of the city (sirens, garbage trucks, voices on the street, etc.). Even when the AC was working it could not keep the room cool in the 80 dgree weather that we experienced in Paris.The superior room that we were given was of good size and we were pleased to find that the bed was actually two twins together rather than the full bed listed on the hotel web site. The rooms need refurbishing (carpet, wallpaper, paint, bedding) and the hotel infrastructure seems dated and overtaxed. After an intense rain storm one night the basement flooded knocking out the power on the first floor and the AC throughtout the hotel - our impression was that this was not the first time this has happened. On the positive side, the staff is one of the best that we have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: s.massey
Reviews.Content: Was expecting incredibly small rooms but our room was good by Paris standards. Very tastefully decorated and comfortable, not alot of storage space but ideal for a short break. Huge ceilings and little or no noise from outside. The location is superb, our room had a part view of the Notre Dame (admittedly between buildings). Excellent restaurants nearby, a must is la (or le?) criee round the corner from the hotel. Superb seafood, we were the only English in the restaurant and although the service is typically French the food more than makes up for it. The hotel staff are extremely helpful and friendly. Didn't try breakfast and there is no evening meal available but don't let that put you off. No English channels on the TV but do you really want that when you're on a break? Make sure you ask the wonderful staff for recommendations on restaurants, but insist that you want the type of restaurant they go to, not tourist places.

Reviews.Title: “Pack some earplugs”
Reviews.Author: timffm
Reviews.Content: The positives - v friendly staff, great location. However. This is a hotel done on the cheap. We went for a romantic break, which was ruined by a lack of sleep - we could hear the people in the next room talking (ie what they were saying), there are loud delivery lorries delivering to the front of the hotel at least twice a night, and the front door closing shook the whole room. We were even woken on the 1st morning by another couple "getting to know each other" intimately. This type of thing is fine in a cheap 2 star near Gare du Nord, but when you pay 4 star prices, I expect more - sleep is the most basic requisite of any hotel. Also, the bathroom was frankly shabby, and the decor over chinzy (but then you may like that) We made a mistake staying there, and regret it

Reviews.Title: “"Perfection in every way!"”
Reviews.Author: chillichesca
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to chose Paris as our little Valentines getaway. As always when trying to find a good hotel, the process took some months, owing to our very particular expectations. It felt like we were going round in circles until I came across the Hotel Le Colbert. This hotel was superb in every possible way. Here are a few reasons why: The Location: Situated a stones throw from Notre Dame and the river. The delightful streets surrounding the hotel are dotted with quaint book shops and informal, friendly cafes. The architecture in this area is perfectly Parisian. Saint Michel metro stop is a 5 minute walk along the river with excellent links to the Gard Du Nord. It is also very worth taking the reasonably priced 'hop on hop off' boat service that will stop off at attractions along the river banks such as the Lourve, Musee d'orsay and the Eiffel Tower, as well as Notre Dame. The Hotel: The website pictures of this hotel made it look very romantic and charming. When we arrived, in the grey drizzle, the hotel looked even better. Spotlessly clean and well manicured. Checking in at reception went like a dream with the staff geniunely wishing you a pleasent stay, with no quams about helping out with any enquiries or issues you may have. In most 4* hotels, the staff have to offer friendly and proffesional service, but at the Colbert, you really felt like they mean it. We booked a superior room due to the very good prices found on their website. The room was truly lovely with decadent furnishings, a genenrous wardrobe and superb bathroom. The bathrobes were a great touch, as was the extensive literature on what to do in Paris. Everything from the comfort of the bed to the water pressure in the shower was spot on. The rooms were cleaned and tidied to a very high standard each day. The bar cum reception room off the lobby was so cosy. Plush furniture and typically french decor ensured an authentic afternoon or early evening drink. We opted not to take breakfast in favour of sampling the local cafes and patisseries. However, we had a sneaky peek at the adorable cellar based breakfast room and it would certainly be a great way to start your day! In a nut shell, this hotel was thoroughly enjoybale, and we both feel almost priviledged to have found and stayed in it. You will not find a better stay in this wonderful city! Little Tips: - EAT: Le Petit Chatelet. We had a little moment trying to get up the nerve to enter this sweet little restaurant just 2 mins from our hotel. But it was Valentines and we wanted something a little special. Once inside we were glad to have taken the plunge. The atmosphere was cosey, friendly and the food was a faultless, melt-in-the-mouth treat! Although a few euros more expensive then the surrounding touristy establishments (the clientelle was in the majority french and had booked in advance, we felt a good sign!), we would have paid double and although we were lucky to get squeezed in, it was well worth the effort to discover this little gem. We can't recommend this place enough. We hope you take the plunge! (They speak good english if you get stuck with the gorgeous and extensive menu of delights!) Starters 8-12 euros, Mains 13 - 25 euros, Drinks around 14 euros for a caraffe of wine. - NIGHTLIFE: Lively - Georges Bar. A funky little club cum bar with a young clientelle although so varied that anyone would blend in just fine and be up dancing in no time! This place is situated down the backstreets of Saint Michel and is great for an early evening cocktail (happy hour is from 5-9pm!) or a great after-meal wind down. Cocktails 11 euros Quirky and Unforgettable- La Caveau de la Hauchette (Jazz Club) Just opposite Georges Bar this club is amazing. One of the last original Jazz Clubs anywhere, for 11 euros during the week you are treated to the best in up-beat jazz from a live guest band. The atmosphere is so informal and friendly you don't want to leave. We had much fun watching over 10 couples strutting their jazzy stuff with huge smiles.
