It seemed to us this realy was a place for anyone to come let their hair-down and really indulge their love of jazz. So realaxing and unique we can't recommend this bar highly enough. So please visit while it stills remains so perfect! Entry 11-13 euros White wine 5 euros per glass Bon Voyage!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lbi8332
Reviews.Content: Loved this little hotel, great location and service..........but no CNN

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Left Bank Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zillexamom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 lovely days in this delightful boutique hotel. It is the perfect left bank location. Quiet street with cafes, restaurants and shops. It was just a short walk to the more lively St.Germain and Latin Quarter. We were upgraded to a junior suite which had view of Notre Dame from every window. The suite with a large lounge area was big and confortable enough to entertain 6 of our friends. The kingsize bedroom was spacious with plenty of closet space and the bathroom was clad in beautiful reddish marble. The public areas were elegant and inviting and would have been the place to entertain our friends if we were in a standard room. Breakfast would make either an American or European visitor happy...eggs, bacon, traditional french pastries and bread, fresh fruit and delicious coffee. The staff was friendly and helpful and went out of their way to make us feel welcome. I would happily stay here again on my next trip to Paris. Bergen County NJ

Reviews.Title: “Small But Perfectly Formed”
Reviews.Author: James_dublin38
Reviews.Content: OK, Do not go to stay at this Hotel if you are expecting big spacious bedrooms and oversized bathrooms. You won't find them. The rooms and bathrooms are very small...no getting away from that fact. Apart from that this is a very cute/boutique hotel in fabulous district in Paris. We arrived a day or two before New Years Eve. Our room was on the corner of the building and had an attractive view of Notre Dame. The Hotel is situated on a quiet street, almost Mews like in an attractive and safe Paris area...nice bars, restaurants close by and the equally interesting and bohemian sorbonne area is a few minutes walk away. The staff were efficient and friendly all delighted to speak English and the hotel was very tidy and has a very attractive bar and lounge area. You may well find more clinical comfort in bigger chain hotels but we stayed here with 5 inches of Snow on the Ground at New Year and its a place that really makes you are getting a genuine Paris experience.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: LGill05
Reviews.Content: Yes the room was small but it was beautifully decorated, clean and well planned. It was cold outside when we were there so we know the heating worked but could not vouch for the AC - it is possible the room would be stuffy in summer. Ideal for a weekend but possibly not for longer (too little wardrobe space). In a quiet side street yet a stone's throw from Notre Dame, the location was fantastic. Many nice restaurants close by including the Percheminerie in the side street of the same name. The hotel staff were friendly and competent in English as well as Spanish. We did not bother with the breakfast because it did seem pricey and there were so many cafes nearby. Another plus was the direct train link (RER Line B) to CDG Airport 8 euros for a single trip from the St Michel Note Dame station close by.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms much too small”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: At US$ 300 a night for a double, this 4 star rated hotel cannot get away with its tiny rooms. We booked this hotel for its location near Notre Dame, but never expected the room we were given. Maybe we were just unlucky, but I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful gem”
Reviews.Author: summercruiser
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small and friendly and 2 blocks from Notre Dame, on the Left Bank. We started out in ground floor rooms which were noisy, and so moved up. The upstairs rooms were great. There is no internet, but there's a cafe 1/2 block away. Great location for sightseeing. Also has a wonderful buffet breakfast. We got a great rate because we booked 9 months in advance. Full rates may be more expensive than it's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Started out bad and never got better...”
Reviews.Author: ZaZaa
Reviews.Content: Yes it is in a good location because it is right by the Notre Dame, but there are a lot of other hotels in close proximity. I had prepared myself to have low expectations of the hotel because I've heard horror stories about European hotels but I found my expectations weren't low enough. Just to name a few of the problems we had: 1) we had to wait 25 minutes in the lobby to be checked in b/c the hotel reception was on the phone with other hotels trying to find a room for a couple whose reservations got screwed up (we finally got fed up and put our foot down and demanded we be checked in immediately) 2) the air conditioning broke.. TWICE and it was about 90 degreed outside!! 3) we found a condom wrapper left in our room next to the bed which the maid miraculously missed the entire 4 days we were there 4) the maid never picked up our champagne and glasses that we were obviously finished with as the ice had all melted and the champange had gone flat 5) there was construction going on in the hotel so it was very loud 6) there was a foul odor in the hotel lobby/hall area (never figured out what it was... smelled like sewage??) 7) the reception was very unsympathetic and lame when it came to reponding to our needs regarding broken air conditioning and heat. 8) we think the maid took one of our hotel keys as we left one in the hotel room in the morning and when we came back it was gone. Overall, this place is a MESS. The people working there are young and inexperienced. I'm very sorry we spent so much for such an awful hotel. Yes, the room sizes are small, but that was the least of our worries during our stay. This hotel has NO redeeming qualities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Magpie1862
Reviews.Content: We had really pleasant stay at the Colbert Hotel in January 2005. The hotel is situated just across the river from Notre Dame in the Latin Quarter on a quite back street. A few of the rooms would have a view of Notre Dam, however this would only be a "very" partial view. Our room overlooked the main entrance to the hotel. The room was very comfortable and clean, with the exception of the cigarette butts in the window box. By Parisian standards it was a reasonable size, the bathroom was quite impressive with it's marble effect tiles. We found all the staff to be particularly helpful and polite. On the down side the breakfast was quite expensive, however you are spoilt for choice of cafes and restaurants all within a few hundred yards of the hotel so this was not a problem in the least. If you a flying into Paris you can get a train right from the airport to within a few hundred yards of the hotel which is really convenient. We will definitely stay here again when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: caltraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister from 2/18-24, and the Melia Colbert is a great hotel in Paris. The location is amazing - very close to Notre Dame. I got the room for ~US$230/night on lastminute, and given where the Euro is these days that is a good price for a nice hotel in Paris! I would not pay the rack rate of Euro 400-500/ night - that is too much. But for US$200-250, this is a nice hotel. The rooms are small by American standards, medium by Parisian standards. We were in room #28, which was bright and sunny with two big windows. Some of the rooms were darker because they only had one window, FYI. The decor is classic French, done in tasteful French blue and white. The bathrooms are all red-brown marble, and have nice amenities like a heated towel rack and a powerful hairdryer. Bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper, as there is noise from loud pedestrians and garbage trucks in the AM - this is a problem in almost any small Parisian hotel. Please note that the 4th floor is the non-smooking floor, and you need to request a non-smoking room in advance if this is important to you. Be sure to call the hotel directly during the daytime in Paris to make this request. I called and got the night clerk, who told me the request was in the system and would be taken care of. When I got to the hotel, I was told there was no record of this request. When I told them I called and spoke to the night clerk, I got rolled eyes, and was told that he is not reliable, and that I need to call during the day next time. The staff at the front desk were very capable, and spoke good English. They got us into a smoking room that did not smell too bad, so we were fine in the end. The breakfast at the hotel is ridiculously overpriced. Instead, get fruit, yogurt, etc. at the gorcery stores nearby, and pasteries at one of the bakeries. Or for the same amount you would be charged at the hotel go to Laduree for an amazing breakfast in a beautiful tea shop instead (Laduree is on rue Bonoparte in the 6th). Don't miss the macaroons here. Also, we bought huge 1.5L waters at the grocery store for Euro 0.50, much better deal than the minibar! For dinner, try Altilier Matrie Albert, a more casual Guy Savoy restaurant a few streets over. Book in advance. They serve roast chicken (the house specialty) and other roasted/grilled stuff. Delicious! The decor is dark, with a huge fireplace at one end. Perfect in the wintertime for a cozy, romantic meal. About Euro 35-50 per person.
